com.dallaway.jsptest
Class Session

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.dallaway.jsptest.Session
public class Session
extends java.lang.Object

HTTP session implementation for managing client state and firing off HTTP requests.

This session is your starting point for all JSP testing. Create a sessions, and from this you can make requests and query cookies.

Set HTTP headers in the session using setHeader(). By default the header "User-Agent" is already set to IE5.0 for NT. You can change this with a call to: session.setHeader("User-Agent", "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; WinNT4.0; en-US; m14) Gecko/20000419").

To support HTTP/1.1, we send the Host: header (e.g., Host: 127.0.0.1:8080).

Other headers you might want to set and suggested values:
HeaderExample values
Accept*&0#047;* or image/gif, image/jpeg
Accept-Languageen-us
AuthorizationBASIC d2vjkkjdfKJHGS873H=
Refererhttp://foo.baz/index.html

...and any of headers you like, but note that Set-Cookie is handled by the addCookie() method.

Version:
$Revision: 1.2 $ $Date: 2000/08/18 09:22:50 $
Author:
$Author: richard $

Method Detail

reset

public void reset()
Clear the sessions. This removes all client-side state information.

Set the user agent string to send to the server.
Parameters:
header_name - The header to send (do not include trailing colon).
value - The value to associate with the header.

getCookieValue

public java.lang.String getCookieValue(java.lang.String cookie_name)
Look up a single cookie value by name.
Parameters:
name - The name of the cookie to look up.
Returns:
value The value associated with the cookie, or null if the cookie was not found.

request

public Response request(java.lang.String url)
                 throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                        java.io.IOException
Request a HTTP URL. The result of this request may update the session state (e.g., if cookie are sent).
Parameters:
request - The HTTP request to make, such as "http://127.0.0.1/hello.jsp" or "http://127.0.0.1/hello.jsp?foo=baz".
Returns:
response The response from the server.
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException - Thrown if the supplied url is badly formed.
java.io.IOException - Thrown if there was any erors reading across the network.

setHTTPVersion

public void setHTTPVersion(java.lang.String version)
Set the HTTP version to send.
Parameters:
version - The HTTP version string, e.g., "HTTP/1.0" (the default).

getHTTPVersion

public java.lang.String getHTTPVersion()
The HTTP version that is being sent with requests.
Returns:
version The HTTP version sent with requests, such as "HTTP/1.0".
